identificationModule.briefTitle: Anti-Platelets in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
identificationModule.officialTitle: Dual Anti-platelet Therapy in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Study

collaborators.name: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a 6 week crossover study in former smokers with and without COPD to evaluate whether 2 weeks of dual antiplatelet therapy (aspirin 81mg and clopidogrel 75mg) improves pulmonary perfusion (i.e. blood flow in the lungs measured on a contrast CT scan) compared to placebo.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This is a single-center Phase IIa randomized double-blind crossover study in smokers with and without chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) to test whether dual antiplatelet therapy (aspirin 81mg and clopidogrel 75mg) improves pulmonary perfusion (i.e. blood flow in the lungs) compared to placebo.

We will enroll 30 subjects (20 with COPD, 10 without) who will each take part for 6 weeks. Participants and researchers will be blinded, they will not know which medications they are on first. Each participant will be asked to take aspirin and clopidogrel together for 2 weeks and also matching placebos for 2 weeks, with a 2 week washout period in between. Pulmonary blood flow will be evaluated with a contrast-enhanced CT scan of the chest two times over the 6 week study.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Double-blind crossover study is a Phase 2 interventional study to assess whether dual-anti platelet therapy improves pulmonary blood flow compared to placebo

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: All participants, investigators and care providers will be blinded as to dual-anti platelet therapy or placebo treatment

armGroups.label: COPD Cases: Dual antiplatelet therapy first, then placebo
armGroups.description: Dual antiplatelet therapy (aspirin 81mg and clopidogrel 75mg) will be given for 2 weeks, followed by 2 weeks without intervention, then 2 weeks of placebo

armGroups.label: COPD Cases: Placebo first, then dual antiplatelet therapy
armGroups.description: Placebos for each therapy (2 pills) will be given for 2 weeks, followed by 2 weeks without intervention, then 2 weeks of dual antiplatelet therapy

armGroups.label: Controls: Dual antiplatelet therapy first, then placebo
armGroups.description: Dual antiplatelet therapy (aspirin 81mg and clopidogrel 75mg) will be given for 2 weeks, followed by 2 weeks without intervention, then 2 weeks of placebo

primaryOutcomes.description: Coefficient of variation (CV) of pulmonary microvascular blood volume on dual energy CT scan, comparing on dual antiplatelet therapy to placebo

secondaryOutcomes.description: Pulmonary microvascular blood volume on dual energy CT scan, comparing on dual antiplatelet therapy to placebo
Coefficient of variation (CV) of pulmonary microvascular blood flow on dual energy CT scan, comparing on dual antiplatelet therapy to placebo
Pulmonary microvascular blood flow on dual energy CT scan, comparing on dual antiplatelet therapy to placebo

otherOutcomes.description: Distal macrovascular pruning on non-contrast inspiratory CT
Percent emphysema-950 on non-contrast inspiratory CT

otherOutcomes.measure: Functional small airways disease on CT
otherOutcomes.description: Functional small airways disease, calculated from gas trapping on non-contrast expiratory and inspiratory CT
Spirometry measures of forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1), forced vital capacity (FVC) and FEV1/FVC
Biomarkers related to endothelial activation (sICAM-1, sVCAM-1, sP-selectin, sE-selectin, vWF), angiogenesis (VEGF, TIMP-1 and PAI-1) and inflammation (WBC, CRP, IL-6, TNF-a, myeloperoxidase).

Platelet activation measures by flow cytometry: circulating monocyte-platelet aggregates (unstimulated), activated GPIIb/IIIa receptor, unstimulated, and stimulated by low and high dose arachidonic acid and adenosine diphosphate, and P-selectin on the platelet surface, unstimulated, and stimulated by low and high dose arachidonic acid and adenosine diphosphate. Also urine 11d-TXB2, plasma TXB2 and aspirin-triggered lipoxin A4

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: This is a small single-center study, we do not plan to share participant level data
